ygData.subject: Re: Dark Elf hide
ygData.msgSnippet: I m not sure who told you that, but here is my experience... Dark Elves also have the racial ability to hide.  When I first created him his ability was a
ygData.messageBody:
I'm not sure who told you that, but here is my experience...

Dark Elves also have the racial ability to hide. When I first created
him his ability was a couple of name levels above "feeble"... something
like "fairly bad". I have since been able to increase my skill once
numeric level, although I do not hide very often. Also, my character
is a warrior.

I did not start out maxxed in my Hide skill, and I would assume that
other races are the same. Perhaps there is a separate racial limit
that is separate from the class limit. Maybe this is Dark Elf only...
I don't know

All I am sure of is that I did not start out with my maximum skill in
Hiding and it certainly is separate from my class (as it is not a class
skill and I am only 5th level). Perhaps the max for the race is 75 but
you actually start out with 25 or 30.

-Drew

By the way... thank you all for your quick replies to my previous
questions. I will try again with the alcohol... perhaps brandy this
time. If you see me around, remind me that I owe you a drink.

I knew my dark elf would have some troubles with KoS, but there may at
least be a chance I could train somewhere. Perhaps I will try to get
bound to the area BEFORE I inquire.... *grin*

--- Virginia Renaut <vrenaut@...> wrote:
> From: Virginia Renaut <vrenaut@...>
>
> OK, here is the FULL scoop on this.
>
> Halflings have the *racial ability* to sneak and
> hide. I don't know what
> "skill level" this translates to, but for
> illustration lets say it is 75.
>
> Depending on your class, you may or may not get the
> *class ability* to sneak
> and hide. If your class does get it, it will be at
> a certain level (your
> guild trainers will show you what level) and you
> cannot put more practices
> into it until that level. Furthermore, using the
> skill will not increase the
> skill until such a time as your class gets the
> skill. Argh, hope I'm being
> clear.
>
> More on this... lets say you have the racial skill
> at 75, and your class gets
> the ability to learn the skill at level 10. At
> level 10 the skill would be
> capped at (level*5)+5 or 55. So even though at 10th
> level your guild will now
> train you in it, they wont because you are already
> maxed out in it.
>
> I don't know any of the specific numbers, nor how
> often this wierd stuff
> happens (although there are a number of races that
> get sneak or hide), but
> this is how it has been explained to me. Use the
> skill if it helps you, but
> don't expect it to improve at all until such a time
> as your guild would train
> you in it.
>
> Phoeble, Traveling Monk of Freeport.0
>
>
